item.title: Revelation 1
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 1

1 The) Revelation of-Jesus Christ that [the] God gave him to-show to-the servants of-him that are-necessary to-occur in quickness/soon, and he-signified (them), having-sent through the angel of-him to-the servant of-him, John, 2who testified the word of-[the] God and the testimony of-Jesus Christ as-many-things-as he-saw. 3Blessed (is) the-one reading and the-ones hearing/heeding the words of-the prophecy and keeping the-things written in it, for the time (is) near.

4 John, to-the seven churches [the] in [the] Asia. Grace to-you and peace from the-One being and the-One he-was and the-One coming, and from the seven spirits that (are) before the throne of-him, 5and from Jesus Christ, the witness, the faithful-One, the firstborn of-the dead and the ruler of-the kings of-the earth. To-the-One loving us and having-loosed us from the sins of-us by the blood of-him, 6and he-made us (into-a) kingdom, priests to-the God and Fathers of-him. To-him (be) [the] glory and [the] might unto the ages of-the ages/forever3 [and-ever2]ms. Amen.

item.title: Revelation 2
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 2

1 To-the angel/evangelist/messenger of-the church in Ephesus write:

2 I-know the works of-yousg and the hard-work and the endurances of-you and that you-are┘not└able to-tolerate evil-(people), and you-put-to-the-test the ones calling themselves apostles and are not, and you-found them false-ones/liars. 3And you have patience, and you-endured on-account-of the name of-me, and have┘not└grown-weary. 4But I-have against you that you-left the first [the] love of-you. 5Remember then whence you-have-fallen, and repent and do the first works. Now if not/otherwise2 I-am-coming to-you, and I-will-remove the lampstand of-you out-of the place of-it, if you-do┘not└repent. 6But you-have this, that you-hate the works of-the Nicolaitans, which I-also hate.

item.title: Revelation 3
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 3

1 And to-the angel/evangelist/messenger of-the church in Sardis write: I-know the works of-you that you-have (a) name that you-live but you-are dead. 2Become alert and strengthen the left-things that were-about to-die; for I-have┘not└found the-works of-you fulfilled before the God of-me. 3Remember then how you-have-received and heard, and keep (it) and repent. If then you-do┘not└wake-up, I-will-come like (a) thief, and you-will┘certainly not└know at-what hour I-will-come upon you. 4But you-have (a) few names in Sardis that did┘not└defile the garments of-them, and they-will-walk with me in white because they-are worthy.

item.title: Revelation 4
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 4

1 After these-things I-looked, and behold (an) open/opened door (was) in [the] heaven, and the first [the] voice/sound that I-heard (was) like (a) trumpet speaking with me, saying, “Come-up here, and I-will-show you what-things it-is-necessary to-happen after these-things.” 2Immediately I-became/was in (the) spirit, and behold (a) throne was-sitting in (the) heaven, and One-sitting on the throne, 3and the-One (was) like in-appearance to-(a)-jasper and sardis/carnelian/cornelian stone, and (a) rainbow (was) around the throne like in-appearance to-(an)-emerald. 4And around the throne (I saw) twenty four thrones, and on the thrones twenty four elders, and seven lampstand of-fire (were) sitting/standing before the throne, which are the seven spirits of-[the] God, 6and before the throne (was) like (a) sea clear like crystal. And in (the) midst of-the throne and around the throne (were) four living-beings full of-eyes in-front and in-back. 7And the first [the] living-being (was) like (a) lion, and the second living-being (was) like (a) calf, and the third living-being (was) having the face like (a) man, and the fourth living-being (was) like (an) eagle flying/in-flight. 8And the four living-beings—each-one3 (was) having six2 wings, around and within full of-eyes, and they-do┘not└have rest during-the-day and during-the-night, saying,

item.title: Revelation 5
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 5

1 And I-saw on the right (hand) of-the-One sitting on the throne (a) book/scroll written inside/front and out/back, securely-sealed with-seven seals. 2And I-saw (a) strong angel proclaiming with (a) loud voice, “Who (is) worthy to-open-up the book/scroll and to-undo/break the seals of-it?” 3And nobody was-able in [the] heaven neither on [the] earth nor under the earth to-open-up the book/scroll nor to-look-at it. 4And I-was-crying/began-to-cry much, because nobody was-found worthy to-open-up the book/scroll nor to-look-at it. 5And one of the elders says to-me, “Do┘not└cry. Behold, the lion [the] of the tribe of-Judah, the root of-David, conquered/overcame to-open-up the book/scroll and the seven seals of-it."

item.title: Revelation 6
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 6

1 And I-looked when the Lamb opened-up one of the seven seals, and I-heard one of the four living-beings saying like (the) sound of-thunder, “Come.” 2And I-looked, and behold, (a) white horse and the-one sitting on it having (a) bow; and (a) crown was-given to-him, and he-went-out conquering and in-order-that he-might-conquer.

3 And when he-opened the second [the] seal, I-heard the second living-being, saying, “Come.” 4And another, fiery-red horse came-out, and to-the-one sitting on it was-given [to-him] to-take peace out-of the earth and in-order-that they-will murder one-another and (a) big sword was-given to-him.

item.title: Revelation 7
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 7

1 After this I-saw four angels standing on/at the four corners of-the earth, holding the four winds of-the earth in-order-that wind might┘not└blow on the earth nor on the sea nor on every tree. 2And I-saw another angel coming-up from the rising of-(the)-sun, having (the) seal of-(the)-living God, and he-shouted with-(a)-loud voice to-the four angels to-whom it-was-given [to-them] to-harm the land and the sea, 3saying, “Do┘not└harm the land nor the sea nor the trees until we-seal the slaves of-the God of-us on the foreheads of-them.” 4And I-heard the number of-the-ones having-been-sealed, (a) hundred fortyᴖfour thousand, having-been-sealed from every tribe of-(the)-sons of-Israel:

item.title: Revelation 8
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 8

1 And when he-opened the seventh [the] seal, silence became in [the] heaven for┘about└ (a)-half-hour. 2And I-saw the seven angels who stood before [the] God and seven trumpets were-given to them.

3 And another angel came and stood at the altar, having (a) gold censer; and much incense[s] was-given to-him, in-order-that he-would-give/put the prayers of-all the saints on the gold [the] altar [the] before the throne. 4And the smoke of-the incense-offerings for-the prayers of-the saints went-up from (the) hand of-the-angel before [the] God. 5And the angel has-taken the incense-container/censer and filled it and from the fire of-the altar and cast (it) into the earth, and thunders and sounds/voices and lightnings and (an) earthquake happened.

item.title: Revelation 9
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 9

1 And the fifth angel trumpeted, and I-saw (a) star out-of the sky having-fallen on the earth, and the/a key of-the pit of-the abyss was-given to-him. 2And he-opened the pit of-the abyss, and smoke came-up out-of the pit like (the) smoke of-(a)-large furnace, and the sun and the air was-darkened out-of/by the smoke of-the pit; 3and out-of the smoke locusts came onto the earth, and authority/power was-given to-them like [the] scorpions of-the earth have authority/power. 4And it-was-said to-them [in-order]-that they-would┘not└injure/harm the grass of-the ground/earth nor any green-plant or any tree, except2/only2 the men who do┘not└have the seal of-[the] God on the/their foreheads. 5And it-was-given to-them [in-order]-that they-will-torment (them) for five months, and the torment of-them (was) like (the) torment of-(a)-scorpion when it-stings (a) person. 6And in [the] those days [the] men will-seek [the] death and will┘certainly not└find it, and they-will-long to-die, and [the] death flees from them.

item.title: Revelation 10
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 10

1 And I-saw another strong angel descending out-of the sky wrapped/dressed in (a) cloud, and a rainbow (was) on the head of-him, and the face of-him (was) like the sun, and the feet of-him (were) like pillars/columns of-fire, 2[and] having in the hand of-him (an) opened-up little-book. And he-put the right [the] foot of-him on the sea, and the left (foot) on [the] land; 3and he-shouted with-(a)-loud voice as (a) lion roars; and when he-shouted, the seven thunders spoke the voices of-them. 4And when the seven thunders spoke, I-was-about to-write, and I-heard (a) voice out-of [the] heaven/sky, saying, “Seal-up what-things the seven thunders said, and do┘not└write them.” 5And the angel that I-saw standing on the sea and on the land, lifted-up the right [the] hand of-him to [the] heaven, 6and he-swore by the-One living unto the ages of-the ages5/forevermore5—who created the sky and the-things in it and the earth and the-things in it and the sea and the-things in it—that time will-be no-longer; 7but/indeed in the days of-the sound of-the seventh angel, when he-is-about to-trumpet—and/that the mystery of-[the] God was-finished when he-evangelized the servants of-himself the prophets.

item.title: Revelation 11
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 11

1 And (a) reed like (a) rod was-given to-me, saying, “Arise and measure the sanctuary of-[the] God and the altar and the-ones worshiping in it. 2And leave-out the court [the] outside the sanctuary and do┘not└measure it, because it-was-given to-the nations, and they-will-tread-on the holy [the] city for forty [and]ms two months. 3And I-will-give to-the two witnesses of-me, and they-will-prophesy (a) thousand two-hundred (and) sixty-days dressed in-sackcloth.

4 These are the two olive-trees and the two lampstands [the] standing before the God of-the earth. 5And if anybody wants to-harm them, fire comes-out from the mouth of-them and devours the enemies of-them. And if anybody wants to-harm them, thus it-is necessary for-him to-be-killed. 6These have [the] authority to-shut-up the sky, in-order-that rain might┘not└rain for-the days of-the prophecy of-them, and they-have authority over the water[s] to-turn them/it into blood and to-strike the earth with every/any plague as-many-times-as2 they-desire. 7And when they end the witness of-them, the beast [the] ascending from the abyss will-make war with them and will-conquer them and will-kill them. 8And the corpse of-them (will lie) in the street of-the great [the] city, which spiritually is-called Sodom and Egypt, where also the Lord of-them was-crucified. 9And they┘from the peoples and tribes and languages and nations└look-at the corpse of-them for-three and (a) half days, and the corpse of-them they-do┘not└allow to-be-put into (a) grave. 10And the-ones dwelling on the earth rejoice over them and celebrate and will-send gifts to-one-another because these [the] two prophets tormented the-ones dwelling on the earth. 11And after [the] three days and (a) half, (the) breath of-life from [the] God entered into them; and they-stood on the feet of-them, and great fear fell on the-ones looking-at them. 12And they-heard (a) voice out-of the sky/[the] heaven, saying to-them, “Come-up here,” and they-went-up into [the] heaven in the/a cloud, and the enemies of-them watched them. 13And in that [the] hour, (a) severe earthquake occurred, and the/a tenth of-the city fell; and (the) names of-(the) men were-killed by the earth-quake, seven thousand; and the rest became fearful and gave glory to-the God of-[the] heaven.

item.title: Revelation 12
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 12

1 And (a) great sign appeared in the sky, (a) woman clothed with-the sun, and the mon (was) under the feet of-her, and on the head of-her (as) (a) crown of-twelve stars, 2and having in (the) womb/being pregnant; and she-is-crying-out suffering-birth-pangs and straining to-give-birth. 3And another sign appeared in the sky, and behold, (a) big red dragon having seven heads and ten horns and seven crown on the head of-it; 4and the tail of-it is-sweeping-down the/a third of-the stars of-the sky, and casting them onto the earth, and the dragon stood in-front-of the woman [the] about to-give-birth, in-order-that when she-bore the child of-her, it-might-devour it. 5And she-bore (a) son (a) male, who will rule all the nations with (an) iron rod. And the child of-her was-snatched to [the] God and to the throne of-him. 6And the woman fled into the desert, where she-has there (a) place prepared by [the] God, in-order-that they-might-nourish her (a) thousand two-hundred (and) sixty days.

item.title: Revelation 13
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 13

1 And I-saw (a) beast coming-up out-of the sea, having seven heads and ten horns and on the horns of-it ten diadems and on the heads of-it (were) names of-blasphemy. 2And the beast that I-saw was like (a) leopardfem, and the feet of-it (was) like (a) bear and the mouth of-it (was) like (a) lion, and the dragon gave to-it the power of-it and the throne of-it and great authority. 3And (I-saw) one of-the heads of-it as-if slain unto death/fatally wounded, and the wound of-the death/fatal wound of-it was-healed. And the whole earth was-amazed after/at the beast, 4and they-worship the dragon that gave [the] authority to-the beast, and they-worshiped the beast, saying, “Who (is) like the beast, and who is-able to-make-was with it?"

item.title: Revelation 14
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 14

1 And I-looked, and behold the Lamb on [the] Mount Zion and with him (a) hundred forty four thousand having the name of-him written on the foreheads of-them. 2And I-heard (a) sound out-of the sky like (the) sound of-many waters and (the) sound of-loud thunder, the sound that I-heard (was) like harpists harping on the harps of-them. 3And they-sing [as-it-were]ms (a) new song before the throne and before the four living-beings and the elders, and nobody was-able to-learn the song except2 the hundred forty four thousand [the] bought from the earth. 4These are who were┘not└defiled with women, for they-are virginsmas; these (are) the-ones following the Lamb wherever2 he-goes. These were-purchased from [the] men (as a) first-fruit to-[the] God and to-the Lamb, 5and in the mouth of-them (a) lie was┘not└found; they-are without-blemish.

item.title: Revelation 15
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 15

1 And I-saw another sign in [the] heaven, great and marvelous, seven angels having seven plagues—the last, because in them the wrath of-[the] God was-finished.

2 And I-saw as-it-were (a) crystal-clear glass sea mixed with-fire and the-ones overcoming from the beast and from the image of-him and from the number of-the name of-him, standing on the crystal-clear [the] sea, having harps of-[the] God. 3And they-are-singing the Song of-Moses, the servant of-[the] God, and the Song of-the Lamb, saying,

item.title: Revelation 16
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 16

1 And I-heard (a) loud voice out-of the sanctuary, saying to-the seven angels, “Go and pour-out the seven bowls of-the wrath of-[the] God on the earth."

2 And the first went-away and poured-out the bowl of-him on the earth, and (a) bad and evil sore/boil came on the men [the-ones] having the mark of-the beast and (on) the-ones worshiping the image of-him.

3 And the second poured-out the bowl of-him on the sea, and it-became blood like (the blood of) (a) dead (man), and evil every soul of-life died, the-things in the sea.

item.title: Revelation 17
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 17

1 And one of the seven angels [the] having the seven bowls came and spoke with me, saying, “Come, I-will-show you the judgment of-the great [the] prostitute [the] sitting on (the) much/many water[s], 2with whom the kings of-the earth committed-sexual-immorality and the-ones dwelling-on the earth got/were-drunk from the wine of-the sexual-immorality of-her."

3 And he-carried┘me└away in spirit into (a) deserted-place, and I-saw (a) woman sitting on (a) red beast, full-of names of-blasphemy, having seven heads and ten horns. 4And the woman was clothed in-purple and scarlet and adorned with-gold and precious stone and pearls, having (a) gold cup in the hand of-her full of-abominations and the defilements/uncleannesses of-the sexual-immorality of-her, 5and on the forehead of-her (a) name written, ‘Mystery,’ ‘Babylon the Great,’ ’the mother of-sexual-immoralities and of-the abominations of-the earth.’ 6And I-saw the woman drunk from the blood of-the saints and from the blood of-the witnesses of-Jesus. “On-account-of what did-you-marvel? I will-tell you the mystery of-the woman and the beast [the] bearing her [the] having the seven heads and the ten horns. 8The beast that you-saw was and is not and will rise-up out-of the deep and goes into destruction, and the-ones dwelling on all the earth, the name of-whom is┘not└written on the book of-[the] life from (the) foundation of-(the)-world, seeing the beast that it-was and is not and will-be-present. 9Here (is) the mind [the] having wisdom: the seven heads are seven mountains, where the woman is-sitting on them. And seven kings are. 10[The] five fell, the one is, the other did┘not-yet└come, and when he-comes it-is-necessary for-him to-remain (a) little-while. 11And the beast that was and is not, is also itself (the) eighth and is of the seven and goes into destruction. 12And the ten horns that you-saw are ten kings, who did┘not-yet└receive (a) kingdom/rule but receive authority as kings for-one hour with the feast. 13These have one purpose, and [the] power and authority of-them they-give to-the beast. 14These make-war with the Lamb, and the Lamb conquers them, because he is Lord of lords and King of kings, and the ones with-him (are) called and chosen and faithful.

item.title: Revelation 18
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 18

1 And after these-things I-saw another angel coming-down out-of the sky having-great authority, and the earth was-lit-up by the glory of-him. 2And he-shouted with (a) loud voice, saying,

4 And I-heard another voice out-of [the] heaven, saying,

6 Pay-back to-her as also she paid,

7 As-many-things-as she-glorified herself and lived sensually,

8 On-account-of this in one day the plagues of-her will-come:

9 And the kings of-earth, the-ones having-committed-sexual-immortality with her and having-lived-luxuriously (with her) will-cry and mourn over her when they-see the smoke of-the burning of-her, 10standing from afar on-account-of the fear of-the torment of-her, saying,

item.title: Revelation 19
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 19

1 After these-things I-heard as-it-were (the) loud voice of-(a)-large multitude in [the] heaven, saying,

3 And (a)-second-(time) they-said,

4 And the twenty four [the] elders and the four living-beings fell-down and worshiped [the] God the-One sitting on the throne, saying,

5 And (a) voice from the throne came-out, saying,

6 And I-heard as-it-were (the) sound of-(a)-large crowd and as-it-were (the) sound of-many-waters and as-it-were (the) sound of thunders, saying,

item.title: Revelation 20
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 20

1 And I-saw (an) angel descending out-of [the] heaven/the sky, having the key of-the abyss and (a) big chain on the hand of-him. 2And he-seized the dragon, the old [the] snake, who is (the) devil and [the] Satan, and bound him for-(a)-thousand years, 3and threw him into the abyss and locked (it) and sealed (it) over him, in-order-that he-might┘not└deceive the nations anymore till the thousand years would-be-finished. After these-things it-is-necessary for-him to-be-loosed for-(a)-little time.

item.title: Revelation 21
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 21

1 And I-saw (a) new heaven/sky and (a) new earth, for the first heaven and the first earth and the sea are not anymore. 2And I-saw the Holy City, (the) New Jerusalem, coming-down out-of the sky/[the] heaven from [the] God, prepared like (a) bride decorated/adorned/made-beautiful for-the husband of-her. 3And I-heard (a) loud voice from the throne, saying, “Behold, the tent/tabernacle of-[the] God (is) with [the] men, and he-will-tabernacle with them. And they will-be peoples of-him, and [the] God himself will-be with them—[(the) God of-them]ms. 4And every tear will-be-wiped-out of the eyes of-them, and [the] death will be neither sorrow nor crying neither suffering/pain will-be anymore [because]ms the first-things passed—away."

item.title: Revelation 22
item.description:
Revelation Chapter 22

1 And he-showed me (the) river of-(the)-water of-life, bright as crystal, flowing-out of-the throne of-[the] God and the Lamb. 2In (the) midst of-the street of-it and the river from-there/on-that-side and from-here/on-this-side (a) tree of-life bearing twelve fruits, according-to every month/monthly bearing the fruit of-it, and the leaves of-the tree (were) for (the) healing of-the nations. 3And every/any curse will┘not└be anymore. And the throne of-[the] God and the Lamb will-be in it, and the servants of-them will-worship/serve him. 4And they-will-see the face of-him, and the name of-him will-be on the foreheads of-them. 5And night will┘not└be anymore, and they-do┘not└have need of-(the)-light of-(a)-lamp and (the) light of-(the)-sun, because (the) Lord [the] God will-shine on them, and they-will-rule unto the ages of-the ages/forevermore.
